clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of Three Methods of Hemoglobin Monitoring in Pediatric Patients Undergoing Major Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Hemoglobin Monitoring During High Bleeding Risk Surgery in Pediatric Patients: Equivalence Study of Hemoglobin Transcutaneous Saturation and Hemocue With Total Serum Hemoglobin

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators compare the accuracy of the SpHb and hemocue with blood Hb levels

detailed_description.textblock: The goal of the study is to compare 3 methods of hemoglobin measurement in pediatric patients undergoing major surgery. During general anesthesia investigators will measure and compare at different periods of time blood hemoglobin levels obtained from a radial artery catheter with 2 non invasive methods of measurement using hemocue and SpHb

primary_outcome.measure: comparison of hemoglobin measurement using 3 different techniques at the time of transfusion decision
primary_outcome.description: comparison of blood hemoglobin obtained by arterial samples with 2 non invasive methods of measurement using hemocue and SpHb

arm_group.description: 3 different techniques will be used for hemoglobine monitoring : hemocue, pulse co-oxymeter (SpHb) and blood measurement

intervention.description: non invasive method of hemoglobin measurement
non invasive method of hemoglobin measurement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Paediatric patients scheduled for major orthopaedi or neurosurgical process under general anesthesia Arterial catheter necessary in the anesthetic protocol. BMI<30 No opposition holders of parental authority and children.
Exclusion Criteria:
Hemoglobin disease Pretreatment with erytropoietin or iron
